JavaScript.name: JavaScript
JavaScript.description: Versatile scripting language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification.

TypeScript.name: TypeScript
TypeScript.description: Strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript.

HTML5.name: HTML5
HTML5.description: Latest version of the HTML standard with new elements, attributes, and behaviors.

CSS3.name: CSS3
CSS3.description: Latest evolution of the Cascading Style Sheets language with new capabilities.

React.name: React
React.description: JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly single-page applications.

Vue.js.name: Vue.js
Vue.js.description: Progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.

Angular.name: Angular
Angular.description: Platform and framework for building single-page client applications using HTML and TypeScript.

Svelte.name: Svelte
Svelte.description: Compiler that takes your declarative components and converts them into efficient JavaScript.

Next.js.name: Next.js
Next.js.description: React framework that enables server-side rendering and static site generation.

React Native.name: React Native
React Native.description: Framework for building native mobile applications using React.

Node.js.name: Node.js
Node.js.description: JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.

Express.name: Express
Express.description: Fast, unopinionated, minimalist web framework for Node.js.

Deno.name: Deno
Deno.description: Secure runtime for JavaScript and TypeScript built on V8.

Flask.name: Flask
Flask.description: Lightweight WSGI web application framework in Python.

Django.name: Django
Django.description: High-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development.

Spring.name: Spring
Spring.description: Application framework and inversion of control container for Java.

MongoDB.name: MongoDB
MongoDB.description: Document-oriented NoSQL database used for high volume data storage.

PostgreSQL.name: PostgreSQL
PostgreSQL.description: Powerful, open source object-relational database system.

Redis.name: Redis
Redis.description: In-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache, and message broker.

Firebase.name: Firebase
Firebase.description: Platform developed by Google for creating mobile and web applications.

GraphQL.name: GraphQL
GraphQL.description: Query language for APIs and a runtime for executing those queries.

GitHub.name: GitHub
GitHub.description: Web-based hosting service for version control using Git.

Docker.name: Docker
Docker.description: Platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers.

Kubernetes.name: Kubernetes
Kubernetes.description: Open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

AWS.name: AWS
AWS.description: Cloud computing platform provided by Amazon.

Azure.name: Azure
Azure.description: Cloud computing service created by Microsoft.

Google Cloud.name: Google Cloud
Google Cloud.description: Suite of cloud computing services offered by Google.

Sass.name: Sass
Sass.description: CSS preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into CSS.

TailwindCSS.name: TailwindCSS
TailwindCSS.description: Utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom user interfaces.

Bootstrap.name: Bootstrap
Bootstrap.description: Free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development.

Material UI.name: Material UI
Material UI.description: React components for faster and easier web development following Material Design.

Rust.description: Multi-paradigm programming language designed for performance and safety.

C++.name: C++
